result.execSummary:
The defendant Todd M Murray was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Election Fraud-Vote More Than Once, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 12.13(1)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Court approves "GOOD TIME RELEASE CREDIT" as to the imposed and stayed sentence.

miscConds.notes: Provide DNA sample and pay DNA surcharge and pay all applicable court costs, fees and surcharges to be paid over period of probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor and may not vote in any election until civil rights are restored.

Comply with the standard rules of probation.
Continue with Adjustment Reactive treatment and follow any recommended treatment.

Court approves probation to be transferred to Waukesha county if accepted.

Cooperate and participate with AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment.
Maintain absolute sobriety and submit to random urine screens.

timeConds.notes: Court approves "GOOD TIME RELEASE CREDIT" as to the condition time, with release privileges for employment and therapeutic treatment purposes only. STAYED UNTIL 01-05-15 AT 12:00 PM.

Defendant Todd M Murray in court with attorney Charles S. Blumenfield.  Bruce J. Landgraf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Sentencing proceeds.  Statements made by the state, defense counsel and defendant. Additional statements made by Dr. Annemarie H.

AS TO COUNT 1:   Defendant sentenced to serve 1 YEAR at the HOUSE OF CORRECTION. 
Credit for ZERO days time served.

COURT STAYS sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for a period of 18 MONTHS.

**Court approves "GOOD TIME RELEASE CREDIT" as to the imposed and stayed sentence.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION: 
* Comply with the standard rules of probation.
* Serve 90 DAYS "condition time" at the House of Correction with release privileges for employment and therapeutic treatment purposes only - STAYED until 01-05-2015 at 12:00 PM.
* Provide a DNA sample and PAY DNA surcharge - to be paid over a perid of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
* PAY the balance of all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges - to be paid over a perid of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
* Continue with Adjustment Reactive treatment and follow any recommended treatment.
* Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety and submit to random urine screens.

OTHER COURT ORDERS:
** Court approves "GOOD TIME RELEASE CREDIT" as to the condition time.
* Court approves probation to be transferred to Waukesha County, if accepted.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Appeal rights given.

Filed:
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement.
Sentencing Referral Form.
Dr. Annemarie H.'s List of Professional Clinical Experiences.

Defendant Todd M Murray in court with attorney Charles S. Blumenfield.  Bruce J. Landgraf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

AS TO COUNT 1:    Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  

FILED, Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form and Addendum.

ADA Landgraf and Attorney Blumenfield contacted clerk by telephone.  Case is scheduled for plea/sentencing on 10-24-2014, however parties are jointly requesting an adjourned date. Case adjourned for plea/sentencing hearing to 12-10-2014 at 1:30 pm in Branch 21.

Defendant Todd M Murray in court with attorney Charles S. Blumenfield.  Bruce J. Landgraf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Parties unable to proceed with a Plea and Sentencing Hearing today.
Judge Donald is attending a family member's funeral.
  Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed.
Case adjourned to 10-24-2014 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Adjourned Sentencing Hearing.

Defendant Todd M Murray in court with attorney Charles S Blumenfield.  Bruce J Landgraf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Original Information filed with the Court today.
Defense counsel waived reading of the Complaint and entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of defendant.
Parties request a Plea and Sentencing Hearing date.
Court GRANTS request.
Case adjourned to 08-08-2014 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Plea and Sentencing Hearing.

Defendant Todd M Murray in court with attorney Charles S Blumenfield.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Arraignment in Branch 02.  Arraignment scheduled for June 23, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 6/6/2014 at 1:00pm
